meanings.definition: No longer fresh or pleasant to eat
meanings.sent1: The bread became stale after sitting out for a few days.
meanings.sent2: The cookies tasted stale because they were left uncovered.
meanings.sent3: The joke was as stale as the bread left out too long.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as stale as the old bread in the pantry.
meanings.sent5: The air in the room was so stale, it felt like breathing in dust.

meanings.sent1: The movie was stale, following the same predictable plot.
meanings.sent2: His jokes were getting stale, and no one laughed anymore.
meanings.sent3: The party had a stale atmosphere, with nothing new or exciting happening.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork felt stale, lacking the creativity it once had.
meanings.sent5: The conversation grew stale, with no fresh ideas being shared.

meanings.definition: To become less appealing or interesting due to overuse or repetition
meanings.sent1: The meme quickly became stale after being shared too many times.
meanings.sent2: His stories tend to stale when he tells them repeatedly.
meanings.sent3: The song started to stale after being played on the radio non-stop.
meanings.sent4: The magic trick would stale if performed too frequently.
meanings.sent5: Her enthusiasm for the project began to stale as the same tasks were repeated.
